METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Jugoslavija, Srbija in Slovenija 1980 - 1990. Kdo je koga izkoriščal?
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Yugoslavia, Serbia and Slovenia between 1980 and 1990: Who Used Whom?
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Jovićević, Zoran
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: V celotnem obdobju obstoja druge Jugoslavije je prevladovalo prepričanje o medsebojnem izkoriščanju enih republik (ali področij) na račun drugih. Ker v zvezi s tem problemom niso bili napravljeni nobeni izračuni ali analize, ki bi takšno prepričanje potrdili ali zavrgli, je takšno stanje vplivalo na povečevanje notranjih napetosti in nezadovoljstva med njimi. Šele v letu 1996 in kasneje, so nastale študije, ki so na osnovi kompleksnejših podatkov in analiz objektivneje prikazale in osvetlile razmere, ter s tem tudi porodile dvome v opravičenost medsebojnih obtožb.

Throughout the existence of the state of Yugoslavia after the Second World War there persisted a firm belief in continuous exploitation of certain Yugoslav republics - or regions - by other republics or regions. Since prior to 1996 there were no studies and analyses that would either confirm or refute these convictions this situation even intensified the already-existing tension within the country, and the discontent that comes with it. It was not until 1996, and in the years that followed, that studies based on more complex data threw additional light upon this subject. Their more objective results gave rise to a speculation that mutual accusations might not have been entirely justified.

Srbija in Slovenija
gospodarske in politične krize
sklad za razvijanje manj razvitih področij

Yugoslavia

less developed regions development fund

METS:xmlData.entity:description: V celotnem obdobju obstoja druge Jugoslavije je prevladovalo prepričanje o medsebojnem izkoriščanju enih republik (ali področij) na račun drugih. Ker v zvezi s tem problemom niso bili napravljeni nobeni izračuni ali analize, ki bi takšno prepričanje potrdili ali zavrgli, je takšno stanje vplivalo na povečevanje notranjih napetosti in nezadovoljstva med njimi. Šele v letu 1996 in kasneje, so nastale študije, ki so na osnovi kompleksnejših podatkov in analiz objektivneje prikazale in osvetlile razmere, ter s tem tudi porodile dvome v opravičenost medsebojnih obtožb.

Throughout the existence of the state of Yugoslavia after the Second World War there persisted a firm belief in continuous exploitation of certain Yugoslav republics - or regions - by other republics or regions. Since prior to 1996 there were no studies and analyses that would either confirm or refute these convictions this situation even intensified the already-existing tension within the country, and the discontent that comes with it. It was not until 1996, and in the years that followed, that studies based on more complex data threw additional light upon this subject. Their more objective results gave rise to a speculation that mutual accusations might not have been entirely justified.
